posts.name: 5000 Burnet
posts.note: 5000 Burnet is a food truck lot with some great food trucks such as B's Kitchen and Gourdough's. Order the wild boar curry if B's Kitchen has it on special or whatever suits your fancy from Gourdough's.

posts.name: Amy's Ice Cream - South Congress Ave
posts.note: Amy's Ice Cream is a local chain is serving inventive ice creams, milkshakes, ices and frozen yogurts with clever fixings. They have all kinds of exotic flavors that seem to change all the time. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: B's Kitchen - Vietnamese and Asian Cuisine
posts.note: B's Kitchen - Vietnamese and Asian Cuisine serves Vietnamese food such as five types of Banh Mi and a half dozen or so meals. If they have it on special to the word from Andrew Zimmern is to order the wild boar curry.

posts.name: Blood Bros. BBQ
posts.note: Blood Bros. BBQ is a casual joint serving classic Texas barbecue plus sides and occasional Asian and Louisiana fusion dishes. From their website, 'All Blood Bros. BBQ meat is supplied by the very best local Texas farms such as Black Hill Meats and 44 Farms.'

posts.name: Boteco
posts.note: Boteco serves Brazilian cuisine which is inspired on flavors from Minas Gerais. Boteco brings Austin a modern take on authentic Brazilian Cuisine.

posts.name: Burns Original BBQ
posts.note: Burns Original BBQ is a longtime family business known for smoked ribs, brisket, housemade sausage, and other BBQ favorites.

posts.name: Café No Sé
posts.note: Café No Sé is a bright spot in the South Congress Hotel for seasonal menus in a chic, rustic-modern space. Café No Sé is an all-day café featuring seasonal breakfast, lunch, and dinner fare, as well as weekend brunch. If you're into burgers, I hear the classic beef cheeseburger, and the shrimp burger is the best.

posts.name: Carpenters Hall
posts.note: From the Austin Eaters website, 'Take the chicken schnitzel, which Grae Nonas saw as his ode to chicken fried steak, bringing together Central Texas, German, and Czech influences. The giant breaded chicken gets served with a black garlic chimichurri, making it all “super rib-sticking,” he explained. One of the dishes he’s most excited about is the pozole verde that is made without any meat whatsoever. “I just wanted to take a stab at it and make something that has the depth and flavor and richness that pozole does have,” Nonas said.'

posts.name: The Clay Pit
posts.note: The Clay Pit serves classic and updated dishes with over 100 wine selections, plus a happy hour in a brick-walled setting. Clay Pit is a nationally - acclaimed, high-energy, contemporary Indian restaurant located in the historical 'Bertram building' in beautiful downtown Austin.

posts.name: Crawfish and Noodles
posts.note: Crawfish and Noodles serve spicy crawfish which tops the menu of Vietnamese and Cajun fare at this contemporary venue with happy hours.

posts.name: Cru Wine Bar
posts.note: Cru Wine Bar is a relaxed, Napa-style wine-bar chain serving New American fare, stone-fired pizzas and cheese plates. In the Dallas Love Field Airport if they have it order the fig and Camembert cheese with a Balsamic reduction on bruschetta. NOTE: They have locations around Dallas and in other airports too.

posts.name: CrushCraft Thai
posts.note: CrushCraft Thai is a casual hangout that serves traditional and modern takes on Thai street food along with drinks including sake and soju. You need to order the Thai Green Curry dish or the green papaya salad or the chicken drunken noodles.

posts.name: Cue’s Burgers and More
posts.note: Cue’s Burgers and More is a laid-back joint with local art on the walls and late hours offering breakfast-to-dinner American eats.

posts.name: Culver’s
posts.note: Culver’s is a fast-food chain specializing in frozen custard and signature burgers made with Midwest beef and dairy. Don't forget to get the butter burger,

posts.name: Franklin Barbecue
posts.note: Franklin Barbecue has long lines form early for brisket, pulled pork and other smoked meats at this lunch-only spot. I consider this the best BBQ in the country. You truly need to get the smoked brisket, smoked turkey, and the hot link sausage along with a few sides.
posts.cptn: An order of beans, brisket, smoked turkey, sausage, and side cole slaw at Franklins BBQ in Austin, TX

posts.name: Fresa's
posts.note: Fresa's is a drive-thru and walk-up Mexican joint doing fire wood-grilled chicken, plus tacos, tortas, and ice cream. You need to order the Achiote and Citrus half chicken. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: G'Raj Mahal Cafe and Lounge
posts.note: G'Raj Mahal Cafe and Lounge is a brick-and-mortar outpost of a former food truck serves Indian fare and has a tented space outdoors. Went with friends and ordered a bunch of dishes to share and pass. The place has a great relaxing atmosphere under canopies and trees lit by Christmas lights.

posts.name: Glazed the Doughnut Cafe
posts.note: Glazed the Doughnut Cafe has gourmet donuts that are whipped up round the clock at this specialty cafe near the Medical Center in the Loop. Where the namesake treat comes in creative cake flavors like sangria, bananas Foster, and eggplant and Parmesan, plus innovative glazes like Dr. Pepper. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Gourdoughs Doughnuts
posts.note: Gourdoughs Doughnuts has ironic names and unique toppings on fried-dough treats served until late-night from a vintage trailer. They have some of the coolest donuts I have ever had. I've seen a few donuts in my day. I ordered a Heavenly Hash doughnut with marshmallow fluff, chocolate chips, hot fudge icing topped with a fudge brownie. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Gourdough's Public House
posts.note: Gourdough's Public House started from 'humble beginnings as a food trailer' to its current brick-and-mortar iteration on South Lamar, this 'guilty pleasure' is known for eclectic, elaborate, gourmet donuts (both 'sweet and savory'). They come à la carte or with meals like burgers, chicken-fried steak, and even salads; cold 'beers on draft' and 'killer cocktails' round out the menu and boost the 'chill' atmosphere.

posts.name: Güero's Taco Bar
posts.note: Güero's Taco Bar is aån extensive menu, salsa bar and hand-shaken margaritas in a landmark building with a patio. They make some of the best breakfast tacos I have had in the state of Texas.

posts.name: Irma's Original
posts.note: Irma's Original has no menu at this kitschy joint doling out homemade Tex-Mex fare and fresh juices. Need to order the tamales and the chiles rellenos stuffed with a ground meat filling known as picadillo.

posts.name: Iron Works BBQ
posts.note: Iron Works BBQ serves Barbecued meats, including signature beef ribs, and specialty sauces in a historic former iron shop. Another wonderful Texas BBQ place in downtown Austin and this one's hidden behind the convention center.

posts.name: Khao Noodle Shop
posts.note: From the Khao Noodle Shop website, 'Khao Noodle Shop is a cozy restaurant in East Dallas, serving Chef Donny’s signature Boat Noodles and other Laotian bites inspired by his mom, his childhood memories of her home-cooking and his travels throughout Southeast Asia. It’s a place to khao gun (come together) and to share home-cooked dishes with friends and family. Chef Donny is fully committed to being a conscious business by sourcing their ingredients from local community gardens and farmer’s markets and reducing their environmental footprint inside the kitchen and out.'

posts.name: Loro
posts.note: Loro is an Asian smokehouse that meets Texas barbecue in a rustic spot with beer, wine, and cocktails along with a giant patio. From their website, 'Loro is an Asian smokehouse and bar brought to you by James Beard Award winners, Chef Tyson Cole of Uchi and Aaron Franklin of Franklin Barbecue.'

posts.name: Louie Mueller Barbecue
posts.note: Louie Mueller Barbecue is a classic barbecue joint serving ribs, sausage, brisket, poultry, and steaks in airy, rustic space. You need to order the beef brisket or any of the three homemade sausages. Here's a quote from their website: 'Louie Mueller Barbecue has been described as a 'cathedral of smoke' due to producing the finest BBQ in Texas since opening its doors in 1949.'

posts.name: Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill
posts.note: Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill is a contemporary comfort food and cocktails in a historic home with a patio. I have never been wrong ordering their pork chop dinner and a side of cornbread.

posts.name: Nam Giao Restaurant and Bakery
posts.note: Nam Giao Restaurant and Bakery is a tiny family-run spot specializing in the food of Hue, a province of central Vietnam. From what I saw on David Chang's Netflix show Ugly Delicious you need to order the crystal shrimp dumpling.

posts.name: Nervous Charlie's
posts.note: From the Nervous Charlie's website, 'At Nervous Charlie’s, we make straight-forward, deliciously simple bagels as well as a variety of ridiculous cream cheeses and sandwiches. We use only the best ingredients that are shipped to us directly from New York City and from right here in Austin. We’re a place for everybody, whether you’re with your family, out for a meeting, or just looking for a low-key breakfast or lunch - any day of the week.'

posts.name: Noble Sandwich Co.
posts.note: Noble Sandwich Co. is a farm-to-table slant applies to big breakfast and lunch in casual, counter-service digs with a patio. You need to order a Smoked Duck Pastrami and a Noble Pig or any of their other gourmet sandwiches, but those two are my favorite.

posts.name: Pueblo Viejo
posts.note: Pueblo Viejo offers a variety of Mexican food ranging from breakfast tacos, street meat tacos, Gorditas, popular Mexican dishes, a variety of sauces, etc. Pueblo Viejo has been open since 2010. While keeping the flavors of their hometown in Mexico, Pueblo Viejo is committed to keeping the freshness and quality that everyone deserves, complemented by friendly service necessary for a complete Mexican food experience.

posts.name: Odd Duck
posts.note: Odd Duck is an upscale eatery doling out locally sourced New American chow and drinks in a contemporary setting. Odd Duck is continuing the philosophy of supporting local farmers, making everything from scratch and working to capture the true craft of cooking in each bite even in the restaurant.

posts.name: One90 Smoked Meats
posts.note: One90 Smoked Meats is the home to passionate artists, meticulous craftsmen, and innovative nerds. They are all three along with combining the old-school craft of the pit master with a high-tech vacuum seal, where they can serve delectable smoked meats at home in just 10 minutes. You need to order the smoked duck sandwich.

posts.name: P. Terry's Burger Stand
posts.note: P. Terry's Burger Stand is a relaxed option for all-natural beef burgers, shoestring fries, and milkshakes, along with breakfast. P. Terry's offers the freshest quality ingredients you can find served out of a drive-thru window. They are where fresh, all-natural, 'never-ever' beef and chicken became staple items. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Petra and the Beast
posts.note: From the Petra and the Beast website, 'The term petrichor refers to the earthy and pleasant scent after the rain falls on dry soil; the meaning and feeling have been adapted to become Petra and the Beast. Petra and the Beast flow with the natural seasons and cycles of the earth to bring unique, pleasant, and hearty reflections from farm, forage, fermentation, and fire to table. Such knowledge and craft continue to be passed on through ever-changing menus. To make an inquiry, see the link above.' You need to order the cured meats at this charcuterie-and-fresh-pasta haven.

posts.name: Salt Lick BBQ
posts.note: Salt Lick BBQ is a BYOB at this venerable cash-only, BBQ spot with a rustic setting and live music outdoors. You need to drive out the original one in Driftwood in the dry county so don't forget to bring your own beer, etc. You need to get the all-you-can-eat BBQ platter which is brisket, smoked sausages, pork ribs, potato salad, cole slaw, and beans along with bread, pickles, and onions. NOTE: They have multiple locations even one at the airport.
posts.rcmmnd: Anthony Bourdain and Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives

posts.name: Smitty's Market
posts.note: Smitty's Market is an acclaimed BBQ spot is offering meats fresh from the smoker in a no-frills space with communal tables. You will need to order yourself some smoked brisket and Jalapeno sausages along with a few sides so you some veggies now and again.

posts.name: Snow’s BBQ
posts.note: Snow’s BBQ is a rural smokehouse serving acclaimed ribs, brisket, sausage, pork, and chicken Saturdays only from 8 AM. ThOwner Kerry Bexley and Tootsie Tomanetz pit master started serving pork on March 1, 2003. For you people that think you're getting old Tootsie is in her early 80s.

posts.name: South Congress Cafe
posts.note: South Congress Cafe is known for its Bloody Mary, carrot-cake French toast and daily brunch and dinner in a retro-modern room. They have hardy breakfast items and a great brunch from what others have told me.

posts.name: Stubb's Bar-B-Q
posts.note: Stubb's Bar-B-Q has beer, brisket and music downtown with a renowned Sunday gospel brunch. Again another can't miss BQQ place that has excellent brisket and sausage in downtown Austin.

posts.name: Ramen Tatsu-ya
posts.note: Ramen Tatsu-ya is a popular noodle house and bar with funky vibe serving classic ramen with many options for topping. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Tasty Kabob
posts.note: From the El Paso Times website, 'Tasty Kabob offers a welcoming atmosphere, with plenty of seating for lunch and dinner. As soon as I walked in, the restaurant was filled with the aroma of two types of meat cooking on rotisseries.' You need to order the Beef Koobideh which is a seasoned beef kabob served with crispy Persian rice (called tadig) and a shallot-yogurt sauce. Or the Ghromeh Sabzi which is an Iranian herb stew that is typically made with sauteed herbs, consisting mainly of parsley, leeks or green onions, and coriander, seasoned with the essential spice of dried fenugreek leaves with beef or lamb.

posts.name: Torchy's Tacos
posts.note: Torchy's Tacos is a local chain is serving Mexican-street-food-style tacos in inventive varieties, including for breakfast. They make some of the best breakfast tacos I have had anywhere in the country. Plus, it's great sitting at picnic tables with others in a gravel parking lot eating with people you don't know at all times of the day. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Underbelly
posts.note: Underbelly is an upscale eatery and on-site butcher shop dedicated to all things pork which features a wine bar.

posts.name: Via 313 Pizza
posts.note: Via 313 Pizza is a trailer outside the Violet Crown Social Club is known for its square, Detroit-style pies have sauce on top. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Van’s Banh Mi
posts.note: Van’s Banh Mi serves flame-grilled meats on fresh bread that make up the banh mi options from the window of a food truck. From their website, 'Van’s Banh Mi is a family-owned Vietnamese Sandwich ( Banh Mi ) cafe on wheels. Our banh mi is baked fresh daily. Our meats are flamed grill fresh to order. Van Lam is the owner/operator of this food truck. He is very passionate about his food. His mission: to provide you the best tasting banh mi experiences. From what I have been told, you should order the Bahn mi, spring rolls, and a noodle dish with peanuts, pickled veggies, and sauce.'

posts.name: Veracruz All Natural
posts.note: Veracruz All Natural is a simple trailer with picnic tables for tacos with spit-grilled meats or veggie options, plus migas. Helen Rosner recommends their migas tacos. From their website, 'Owners Reyna and Maritza Vazquez are sisters and best friends. They were born and raised in Veracruz, Mexico, and moved to Austin, TX after graduating from High School. In May of 2006, Reyna had saved up enough money to buy her first trailer, and a month later, she opened it up and started to sell smoothies and juices. She had to close a few months later, but persistent with her dream, she reopened in April of 2008 on East Cesar Chavez with her sister Maritza as her business partner. NOTE: They have two food trucks and two brick and mortar locations.'

posts.name: Whistle Britches
posts.note: Whistle Britches serves fried chicken and biscuits, meet beer and cocktails at this airy, rustic spot with an expansive patio. You need to order the Hot Jane chicken sandwich.

posts.name: Wu Chow
posts.note: Wu Chow serves Sichuan cuisine and weekend dim sum brunch in a contemporary space. Think they serve a dim sum brunch on the weekends, but you check first before going. Order the chicken boa which li's like a mini chicken.
